description: The brome-like sedge (Carex bromoides) is an amazing species of plant. Its foliage adds beauty to gardens, growing in tight-knit mounds that turn bronze-like in colour during colder months. Its wiry stems can reach 1-2 feet tall and can spread up to 1.5 feet wide. It blooms in the late spring with long and slender spikes of greenish-white spikes up to 8 cm in length. It’s an attractive plant that functions best in moist soils of container gardens, median borders, and rock gardens. It’s deer resistant and does well in sun or light shade. Brome-like sedge is a great species for wildlife and pollinators; its flowers provide nectar and its leaves form rosettes and provide protective cover.
